Hi, this is a great opportunity to present a tangible solution. Perhaps a sketch of how a health worker would use these or what they might look like would be great. How could this help make the sequence of removing protective gear more intuitive especially considering fatigue and urgency to escape the heat of the suits?

description: I'm thinking about gloves that are automatically triple-layered for appropriate decontamination undress. Maybe a zip tab (like usps priority mail envelopes) to rip off individual layers as needed? Pre-layered gloves could reduce the amount of packaging and time needed to suit-up. Plus triple-layer gloves go above and beyond CDC/WHO recommendations.
summary: Read article from Scientific American about "The Cleaning Guys" who do biohazard cleaning (e.g., Dallas Ebola). They use triple layers of gloves so they can safely undress without accidentally infecting themselves. Instead of three layers of gloves, what about one set of gloves that automatically have three layers. Could reduce packaging and time needed to get suited up.
title: Pre-triple layered gloves
